    \label{QSTK:csvconverter:csvapi:StockPriceData:getSymbols}
    \index{QSTK \textit{(package)}!QSTK.csvconverter \textit{(package)}!QSTK.csvconverter.csvapi \textit{(module)}!QSTK.csvconverter.csvapi.StockPriceData \textit{(class)}!QSTK.csvconverter.csvapi.StockPriceData.getSymbols \textit{(method)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

\hspace{.8\funcindent}\begin{boxedminipage}{\funcwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{getSymbols}(\textit{self}, \textit{listOfPaths}, \textit{fileExtensionToRemove})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
\textbf{Bug:} This might not work if the path contains a folder whose name has .csv, or 
is some random file that has a .csv in it.. So, lets assume that whoever is
using this is not going to "cheat" us



    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{QSTK:csvconverter:csvapi:StockPriceData:getData}
    \index{QSTK \textit{(package)}!QSTK.csvconverter \textit{(package)}!QSTK.csvconverter.csvapi \textit{(module)}!QSTK.csvconverter.csvapi.StockPriceData \textit{(class)}!QSTK.csvconverter.csvapi.StockPriceData.getData \textit{(method)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

\hspace{.8\funcindent}\begin{boxedminipage}{\funcwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{getData}(\textit{self}, \textit{listOfListOfStocks}, \textit{listOfInputPaths}, \textit{startDate}, \textit{endDate}, \textit{listOfOutputPaths})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
\textbf{Attention:} Assumption here is that past data never changes



\textbf{Bug:} The exchange is currently set pretty randomly



    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{QSTK:csvconverter:csvapi:StockPriceData:makeOrUpdateTimestampsFile}
    \index{QSTK \textit{(package)}!QSTK.csvconverter \textit{(package)}!QSTK.csvconverter.csvapi \textit{(module)}!QSTK.csvconverter.csvapi.StockPriceData \textit{(class)}!QSTK.csvconverter.csvapi.StockPriceData.makeOrUpdateTimestampsFile \textit{(method)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

\hspace{.8\funcindent}\begin{boxedminipage}{\funcwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{makeOrUpdateTimestampsFile}(\textit{self}, \textit{fileName}, \textit{listOflistOfStocks}, \textit{listOfInputPaths}, \textit{startDate}, \textit{endDate})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
\textbf{Bug:} Formerly did not take care of DST



\textbf{Attention:} fixed DST bug. No known DST problems now.



    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{QSTK:csvconverter:csvapi:StockPriceData:continueChecking}
    \index{QSTK \textit{(package)}!QSTK.csvconverter \textit{(package)}!QSTK.csvconverter.csvapi \textit{(module)}!QSTK.csvconverter.csvapi.StockPriceData \textit{(class)}!QSTK.csvconverter.csvapi.StockPriceData.continueChecking \textit{(method)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

\hspace{.8\funcindent}\begin{boxedminipage}{\funcwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{continueChecking}(\textit{self}, \textit{tsList}, \textit{beginTS}, \textit{endTS})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
\textbf{Bug:} There is a Daylight savings time bug here too- but it won't adversely 
affect anything because DST always happens over the weekends! Though if the
time change happens on a weekday sometime in the distant past/future this 
function may break.



    \end{boxedminipage}
